description:
Students of this amazing adventure into the world of screenwriting will learn the art, craft, creative, and technical skills necessary to conjure up, develop, write, rewrite, format, and market an original screenplay, potentially leading to script sales and/or employment in various entertainment industry, marketing, sales, commercial, informational, industrial, and media production enterprises. Storytelling and story structural skills can also be essential in interpersonal communications and business presentations.

Providing insight into how stories communicate meaning through a unique language system (the language of visual storytelling and the format of a screenplay), students will examine structural tools and stylistic techniques they can apply toward a variety of projects and job opportunities.

Thus, students of this course may go on to successfully become a screenwriter, script consultant, script doctor, script supervisor, script coordinator, television show creator/runner, writer's assistant, script reader, story analyst, development executive, producer, director, documentarian, literary agent, proofreader and/or story editor.
title: Scriptventures: The Art & Business of Screenwriting
